Package org.forgerock.openam.radius.server.spi.handlers.amhandler

Class ContextHolder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.forgerock.openam.radius.server.spi.handlers.amhandler.ContextHolder
  • public class ContextHolder
extends Object
    Holds server side info for an authentication conversation in progress for a user via a radius client.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  ContextHolder.AuthPhase
      Indicates what phase of authentication we are in.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructs a ContextHolder with its unique key.

      • getCallbackSetProps

        public PagePropertiesCallback getCallbackSetProps()
        get the callback set properties.
        Returns:
        the callback properties for the current module.

      • setCallbackSetProps

        public void setCallbackSetProps​(PagePropertiesCallback callbackSetProps)
        Sets the callback properties for the module currently being processed.
        Parameters:
        callbackSetProps - - a PagePropertiesCallback reference.

      • getModuleName

        public String getModuleName()
        Gets the name of the module.
        Returns:
        the name of the module currently being processed, or null if no module is being processed.

      • setModuleName

        public void setModuleName​(String moduleName)
        Sets the name of the module currently being processed.
        Parameters:
        moduleName - - a non null string containing the name of the module.

      • incrementChainModuleIndex

        public void incrementChainModuleIndex()
        Increments the chain module index to indicate that the next module in the chain is currently being processed.

      • getChainModuleIndex

        public int getChainModuleIndex()
        Get the chain module index.
        Returns:
        The zero based index of the current module in the chain for whom we are gathering values from the user. -1 indicates that there is no module set. This is so that we can centralize updating this info set without regard to whether we are handling the first set or following sets.

      • getCallbacks

        public Callback[] getCallbacks()
        Gets the array of callback objects for the chain.
        Returns:
        an array of Callback objects.

      • setCallbacks

        Sets the array of Callback objects for the chain.
        Parameters:
        callbacks - an array of Callback objects.

      • setMillisExpiryForCurrentCallbacks

        public void setMillisExpiryForCurrentCallbacks​(Long millisExpiryForCurrentCallbacks)
        Sets the period in milliseconds until the current callback expire.
        Parameters:
        millisExpiryForCurrentCallbacks - a Long representing the number of milliseconds until the current callback expires.

      • getMillisExpiryPoint

        public Long getMillisExpiryPoint()
        gets the point at which the current context holder expires.
        Returns:
        the difference, measured in milliseconds, between the context holder's expiry time and midnight, January 1, 1970

      • setMillisExpiryPoint

        public void setMillisExpiryPoint​(Long millisExpiryPoint)
        Sets the point at which the current context holder expires.
        Parameters:
        millisExpiryPoint - the difference, measured in milliseconds, between the context holder's expiry time and midnight, January 1, 1970

      • getCacheKey

        public String getCacheKey()
        get the cache key of this context holder.
        Returns:
        a String object containing the key for the context holder.

        Parameters:
        authPhase - an AuthPhase object.

      • getUniversalId

        public String getUniversalId()
        Obtain the universal ID from the SSO token held by the auth context. If there is no SSO token available or there is no universal id available then null will be returned.
        Returns:
        the universalId, or null if none is available.
